{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.21496v1", "title": "Bounded displacement permutations on the integers", "summary": "It is shown that if each element of a group $G$ of permutations on
$\mathbb{Z}$ displaces points by a bounded distance, then infinitely divisible
elements of $G$ are torsion. One can replace the metric space $\mathbb{Z}$ with
one which is sufficiently tree-like and having uniform bounds on the
cardinalities of balls of a given radius. As a consequence we give a positive
solution to a problem of N. M. Suchkov in the Kourovka Notebook.", "main_category": "math.GR", "categories": "math.GR,math.CO", "published": "2025-04-30T10:30:33Z"}
